content:
Drug: Naltrexone | cid: 5360515
Source: erowid | Source description: Information about Naltrexone (ReVia) including uses, images, dosage, effects, legal status, and links to other resources.
Erowid name: naltrexone
Category: PHARMS
Field: MainPage

                    Text: 
                    Naltrexone



COMMON & BRAND NAMES

ReVia; Trexan; Vivitrol; Nalorex; Depade

EFFECTS CLASSIFICATION

Narcotic detoxification adjunct

CHEMICAL NAME

(5a)-17-(cyclopropylmethyl)-4,5-epoxy-3,14-dihydroxymorphinan-6-one

DESCRIPTION

Naltrexone is an opiate antagonist used in the treatment of opiate and alcohol addiction. It blocks the effects of opiates so that if a user chooses to take an opiate after taking naltrexone, they do not experience much, if any, effect. This helps improve abstinence in those who can maintain taking the daily dose of naltrexone.

BASICS

EFFECTS

IMAGES

HEALTH

LAW

DOSE

CHEMISTRY

ASK EROWID ANSWERS #

Does naloxone come in tablets, for use in case of an OD?

RESEARCH & JOURNAL ARTICLES #

Injectable extended-release naltrexone for opioid dependence [...], 2016

Obviation of opioid withdrawal syndrome by concomitant administration of naltrexone [...], 2006


                    Context: 
                    This chunk is the main entry for naltrexone in Erowid's Pharmaceuticals Index, providing essential information such as brand names, effects classification, chemical name, description of its use in treating opiate and alcohol addiction, and links to related sections like basics, effects, health, law, dosage, chemistry, FAQs, and relevant research articles. It is part of a larger resource on psychoactive substances, their uses, effects, and legal status.

It follows the description, effects, and basic information about naltrexone and offers links to studies, first-person accounts, informational websites, and media coverage relevant to its medical use and efficacy.
